Belgium: Duke of Alva banishes thirty inhabitants of the city of Antwerp and their spouses, with forfeiture of property, for supporting or disseminating Calvinism – including the pensionary of the city, Jacques van Wesenbeke, and the head of the Calvinist consistory in Antwerp, the Portuguese merchant Marcus Perez.
Philippine: The Portuguese, under the command of General Gonzalo de Pereira, attack Cebu and blockade its port.
Spain: Dutch Revolt: A revolt began against Habsburg control of the Netherlands.
